TopicTitle: The Ui Flicker Bug - In stock

Articles.Content:
TriggerAu, from what I've seen the flicker in the AppTray is limited to the content of the menus themselves, not the icons in the AppTray. To clarify : if the whole UI is flickering and you open the Engineer window for instance, the content of that window will not be shown.

I haven't seen this bug so much though, on my end it was limited to the parts catalog which flickered a lot. I'm really glad you got it fixed because I can build anything without the whole thing just flickering in and out a couple times per second right now.

24 minutes ago, Jashin said:

TriggerAu, from what I've seen the flicker in the AppTray is limited to the content of the menus themselves, not the icons in the AppTray. To clarify : if the whole UI is flickering and you open the Engineer window for instance, the content of that window will not be shown.

I haven't seen this bug so much though, on my end it was limited to the parts catalog which flickered a lot. I'm really glad you got it fixed because I can build anything without the whole thing just flickering in and out a couple times per second right now.

The fix for the UI stuff Ive done did include tweaking the content of those, just blind fixes arent my favorite kind
@RoverDude I wonder if it has anything to do with the tagging system.  As more mods add tags. Is it possible that something in the tagging system is getting overloaded?

Is just the app items not displaying that I want to try and repro to confim that is fixed to in our dev builds.

11 minutes ago, TriggerAu said:

Is just the app items not displaying that I want to try and repro to confim that is fixed to in our dev builds. 

For me, the categories disappear, the content of the stock UI buttons disappears (the windows appear but are empty), the action buttons in the top right disappear except for their very bottoms, and any mod buttons to the left of the stock buttons in the lower right disappear.  Interestingly, you can still USE the mod buttons if you remember where they were on the screen the last time they flickered and click that spot.

In my mod folder I have:

Spoiler

 

000_AT_Utils

000_USITools

AirplanePlus

AviationCockpits

ChopShop

CommunityCategoryKit

CommunityResourcePack

DMagicOrbitalScience

ExtraplanetaryLaunchpads

Firespitter

Hangar

HLAirships

KAS

KerbalJoingReinforcement (dev)

KerboKatz (containing the science retriever and kerbal science exchange)

KIS

KSP-AVC

LETech

MechJeb2

ModuleManager 2.7.1

PartCommanderContinued

PlanetaryBaseInc

SCANsat

SpaceY Expanded

SpaceY Lifters

TarsierSpaceTech

TextureReplacer

ThrottleControlledAvionics

TriggerTech (ARP)

Tweakscale

UmbraSpaceIndustries (Akita, ART, FTT, Karibou, Construction, Containers, Lifesupport, MKS, ReactorPack, WarpDrive)

WaypointManager

WildBlueIndustries (Buffalo & Pathfinder)

Workshop

 

Hope that helps.

Also, I'm on MacOS sierra, MacBook pro mid-2014, 8 gb ram.

Still getting the dreaded flicker. I believe the flicker of the contracts, engineering and toolbar menu is restricted to career mode, but a reliable way to reproduce, or at least I've found, is install a few mods which add to the toolbar in editor (Editor extensions, hyperedit, RCS Aid, USI life support). From there, boot up a fresh career mode, and unlock a few research nodes, then upgrade Mission Control to level 2 and get as many contracts as possible. Then cause the flicker bug in VAB/SPH and it *should* recreate the toolbar, contracts and engineering. If it doesn't then let me know and I'll see what else I did. I've tried this on two different career saves and it affected it both times. Through a brief amount of testing I do not believe it can be caused in sandbox mode. 

Any problems recreating let me know and I'll help out as best I can. Cheers again, Aus

@TriggerAu

You can view/install this .ckan config file, start the game, start a new career, go to the VAB, move the mouse and the UI/Toolbar is gone. Just tested it again. Hope that helps.

 

PS: Do you have a very rough assumption if its a matter of days or weeks until this fix reaches us? This CKAN config is 95% of the career I would like start since the mods came out but this is totally not playable for me. On the other hand after 2 light modded careers in the prerelease, I don't want to go back to 1.1.3... so I only can wait.

Taken a load of mods off & got the bug to disappear, as soon as I start adding mods back it comes back. As soon as I added "Procedural Fairings" & "WildBlueIndustries" the bug reappeared. Independently both mods work without the bug, together the bug appears. Not tried any additional combo's yet. As for the part count idea, no category has more than 72 (3x24) parts in it so its less than the 100 that has been mentioned before.

*Edit* testing done in sandbox mode (in case contracts had an impact)

Edited October 21, 2016 by Speadge

A) No need to be rude
B) Second reply quoted only states that the fix he has done includes tweaking content & his dislike of blind fixes.
C) The first quote is actually ASKING for information about what mods cause it (ergo by ruling out mods also fulfils the opposite half of that proposition).

Now the thing about crowd based information is this; the more information you share between people tracking down bugs the greater the speed of tracking the bug, thus by posting mods that are not causing the issue people can rule them out, or if they encounter the issue with a mod I ruled out they can post & where the mods have a cross over you can locate possible avenues to explore further.

So I am going to keep going through the list of mods I have trying to reproduce the bug, thus finding which mod/s are responsible, and keep updating the spoilers (so ppl do not have to read them if they dont want to) to better facilitate a speedy resolution.

The second two replies you edited in I cannot even find on this thread... by time (15 hours ago) or by searching the thread via ctrl+f & searching for the quoted remarks.

I have this same issue...  I thought it was a mod causing the problem so I spent days removing and reinstalling mods. and every time I thought I had found the culprit the problem would come back.  eventually I decided it was not a specific mod, but the number of mods.  or as you say maybe the number of parts in a category.  it only happens inside the VAB or SPH and it does not cause the game to break as far as I can tell.  it is running fine, and I can play for hours like this.  it is just a hassle to deal with the UI issues in the editor.

 

if it caused by a "single" mod and not the total number of them, then there are a few that do it.  as I thought I had found the problem many times just to have it come back.
